Dissenting Opinion vs. Difference of Opinion
For the purpose of this section:
a
dissenting opinion
scenario occurs when multiple decision makers whose signatures are required on a rating decision do not concur on some aspect of an
unpromulgated
decision, and
a
difference of opinion
scenario occurs when a decision maker is of the opinion that revision or amendment is needed (for reasons that do not qualify as clear and unmistakable error (CUE)) of a
promulgated
rating decision completed by another decision maker.
